result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:15 AM Defendant Alexis O Lopez in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Alexis O Lopez, and as a friend to the court in 22CT1155.  Atty Scott Connor appears as a friend to the Court. Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin.

10:48 AM Defendant Alexis O Lopez in court.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer in court for Alexis O Lopez.  Prosecuting attorney Peter Michael Tempelis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defense acknowledges receipt of amended complaint and waives reading of complaint. City of Brookfield Police Department Officer Jason Krueger sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Tempelis. Cross examination by Attorney Nimmer. State rests. State moves for bind over with argument. Attorney Nimmer objects to bind over with argument. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
Hearing scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim A/Victim B/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant is not to discuss this case with Witness B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.

02:25 PM Defendant Alexis O Lopez in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Victim A appeared in court requesting the Court not grant a no contact order.  State requests GPS monitoring.  The Court will not order GPS monitoring but does order no contact orders with Victim A/Victim B and Witness A.  Attorney Nimmer raises the issue that Count 3 (Misd. Theft) cannot have a domestic abuse modifier as it does not qualify under the statute and requests the Court either dismiss the charge or reserve the right to challange at a further date.  State requests this matter be addressed at a further date.  The Court notes defense objection to Count 3 and will allow this to be addressed at the next date.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:15 am.
WCS Pre-trial Report
Signed by Judge Jennifer R. Dorow on 7/15/22.
